title: Branch Wars
description: Michael and Dwight try to play a prank on Karen, who is now manager of the Utica branch, after she tries to steal Stanley from the Scranton office. Meanwhile, Pam, Toby, and Oscar start their own exclusive office book club.

quotes.speaker: Rolando
quotes.text: [on phone] Dunder Mifflin, this is Rolando.  Oh yes, she's been expecting your call. [knocks on door]

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Rolando
quotes.text: Karen?  He's on line one.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Thanks Ro.  Hey, we finally connected.  How's Scranton?

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: I am the regional manager of Dunder-Mifflin Utica branch.  Turns out it's a pretty easy gig when your boss isn't an idiot and your boyfriend's not in love with somebody else.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Look, All I'm saying is it would be a great opportunity, and we'd love to have you come aboard.  So think about it, okay?  Okay, bye.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Look, for the record, a certain Scranton salesman approached me, okay?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: This is perfect.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: He looks like your twin.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: This is a dummy, a la Ferris Bueller's Day Off.  We have tied a string to the wrist, which goes to the door.  When somebody opens the door, the hand goes down, hits the remote, turns on the tape recorder, which is me snoring.  Now nobody knows whether I am here, or whether I am gone.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I will know.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: But, you will not tell anyone.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I won't need to because we'll be together playing hooky.  Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, sometimes.  Most of the time I will be with Ryan, or Darryl.  [knock on the door]  Yes?  Oh good, good Stanley!  First victim, this is what I want you to do.  Go out, come back in.  We're going to hide.  I want you to tell me if this looks like me, okay?

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: I don't understand why sleeping at your desk is better than you not being here.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Just go out, and come back in.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: I got an offer from Utica for more money, and I'm going to take it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey everyone, can I have your attention please?  I just thought you all should know that Stanley Hudson is planning on leaving us, because our old friend Karen from Utica is going to give him more money to work there.

quotes.speaker: All
quotes.text: [applause]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, no, no, no, no-no, no no.  You completely misinterpreted my tone, this is a horrible thing.  Clearly, Karen is trying to get back at us because Jim dumped her.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, I don't think that is what's happening.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, smarty pants, then why?  Why is she trying to take Stanley from us?

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: I think it's because of my sales record.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That could not possibly be it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You cannot take the hilarious black guy from the office.  Stanley is part of what makes this branch so extraordinary.  The bluesy wisdom, the sassy remarks, the crossword puzzles, the smile, those big watery red eyes.  I don't know how George Bush did it when Colin Powell left, and if Utica thinks that they are going to poach Stanley, they have another thing coming.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: How can I get you to stay?

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Money.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah we all want money.  But there is none in the budget, so... Tell me why you're really leaving.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Money.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Mo money mo problems, Stanley.  You of all people should know that.  Let me ask you this, if I were-

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Money.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Pssh, kay.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oscar, did you bring it?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: To be Edwardian.  His best work.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Okay, well I have the tablecloth, don't forget the flatware.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Sure thing Pam, can't wait.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oscar, Toby, and I are founding members of the Finer Things Club.  We meet once a month to discuss books and art, celebrate culture in a very civilized way.  Sometimes the debate can get heated, but we're always respectful.  There is no paper, no plastic, and no work talk allowed.  It's very exclusive.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Besides having sex with men, I would say that the Finer Things Club is the gayest thing about me.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: So tell me again why I can't be part of your club?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Because some people think you monopolize the conversation by trying to be funny.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oscar?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Some people.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: [on phone] Hello?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Fillipellers, how's it hanging?

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Michael...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: To the left?

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Listen, I-

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: To the right?

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: I'm-

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, enough small talk, go ahead.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: You called me.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes, listen, um...  You cannot tear Stanley from his family like this.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: I'm pretty sure his family's coming with him.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, his work family.  Look, this is very hard for me, but I'm going to give you my best man.  You may have Toby.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Toby's not a salesperson.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You can train him.  He's very very smart, and funny, and charming... You know, I can't do it, Toby is the worst.  That- that was a bluff, um...  Listen, if you are going to poach one of my guys, I'm going to poach one of yours.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Oooh.  Good-bye Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, good-bye.  Wait!  Wait! Karen, could you transfer me to one of your salespeople please?  Your best one?  [Karen hangs up]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I have Ben Nugent on the line, he is the top salesman in Utica.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hi Ben, Michael Scott.

quotes.speaker: Ben Nugent
quotes.text: Hi Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I'm going to cut right to the chase here.  Do you like magic?  Because I'm a genie in a bottle, and I'm going to grant you three wishes.  To move to Scranton, to have a great job, and to be my best friend.

quotes.speaker: Ben Nugent
quotes.text: Aren't you the guy that hit the woman with your car?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [giggles]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [to Pam] Get out. [to Ben] Uh, yeah.  I also saved her life, but I guess that's not as grabby.

quotes.speaker: Ben Nugent
quotes.text: Everyone says Scranton branch is worse than Camden.  Didn't everyone from Stanford quit, like immediately?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, I fired them, and your next. ... So what do you say?

quotes.speaker: Ben Nugent
quotes.text: Seriously?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What is that guy talking about?  Scranton is not lame.  Scranton is the cool, fun branch.  We're like Animal House.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Found him!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Jim, we're getting crapped on.  Word is that our branch sucks, and we have to do something about it.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: So what are you going to do?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What are we going to do?  We are going to make a monster sale, that's what we're going to do.  Corcroan dropped Staples.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Did they?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes they did, oh yes they did, and we are going to murder it.  You, me, Dwight are going to jump into my PT Cruiser, and we're going to crush this sale.  We're going to prove, what the hell is that music?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: It's Vivaldi, for Finer Things.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That's the problem, that's the problem.  We need rock n' roll Pam, rock n' roll.  Alright? [sees Toby in a bow-tie holding a plate full of tea cups] Oh... My... God, that's why people are leaving.  I- I have no words.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: We just passed the exit for Corcroan.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What? What? We did?

quotes.speaker: {Dwight} and {Michael}
quotes.text: Surprise!  Ha, ha, ha, ha, ha.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Look at his face! Look at his face!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What are we doing?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Egg dripping, blah, blah, blah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What are we doing, Dwight, what we are doing?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Well, gee, Jim, I don't know, I guess there's no sales call today.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: We are going on a panty raid to Utica, is what we're doing.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: We're going to Utica?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Uh-huh.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I'm not going to Utica right now.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes you are.  Oh, buckle up Jim.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: We are going to make Karen wish that she had never been dumped by you.

quotes.speaker: {Michael} and {Dwight}
quotes.text: [chanting] Utica! Utica! Utica!

quotes.speaker: {Michael} and {Dwight}
quotes.text: [chanting] Utica! Utica!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: In your face

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yow!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I can't believe you guys.  I'm not going to go further piss off my ex-girlfriend.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Are you calling Karen?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No, I'm not calling Karen.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: He's lying.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yep, get it.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What are you doing? Stop it, Dwight!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [throws Jim's cell phone out of the window] Gah-ah-hah-ha!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Are you kidding me?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No communication with the outside world Jim.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It had to be done, it had to be done.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Well, that kind of sucks, because it had all the photos of my brother's new baby on it, so...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh no, that is too bad.  Shoot.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey Dwight, he found it.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You know what?  I'm just going to call a cab from here.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Alright, you're going to miss the best prank ever.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Alright.  Wait, what are you planning on doing?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Do you really wanna know?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, God. [hangs up phone]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Follow me, come here.  Here's what we brought, we brought uniforms from the warehouse.  I brought silly string, Dwight brought gasoline and chunks of rubber to make stink bombs.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Or real bombs.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, no, not real bombs.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yeah, come on, it will be so badass.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Uh, maybe, maybe, I don't know.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It could be badass.  Yeah, it will.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No, no absolutely we are not doing this.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Come on, I already filled the bottles with the gas, it's going to be so badass.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Are you kidding me?  We've been driving around with this stuff in the trunk the whole time?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Teach her to offer Stanley more money.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: So the deal was, Dwight doesn't blow anything up, and I wear a costume.  And a moustache.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: So, why did you and Karen break up?  Was it the sex?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I can't imagine the sex being bad, I mean her body is...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay, you know what?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: ...awesome.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Why don't we play that alphabet game that you were talking about?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, I will start.  Um, "A." [singing] "A" my name is Alan, and my wife's name is Alice, we live in Alaska, and we sell...  Damn it! What do we sell?  Um...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: It doesn't matter.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I'm trying to think of what we could sell.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Doesn't matter.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ah, la, la, la. What is that?  That sound...  The air-conditioning leaking or something?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: That doesn't make sense, couldn't be.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What is that?  Dwight, are you peeing?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I'm peeing in this empty can.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh my God!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Come on man, that is disgusting Dwight!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Well you said that we couldn't make anymore stops, and I really had to go.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Michael, watch the road!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Hey, you're making me spray!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I'll kill you man!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Michael! Michael, pull over!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That is just so disgusting!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Pull over, pull over!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I think I cut my penis on the lid!

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Can you imagine a life where all you have to do is summer in the Italian countryside?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: I know right?  I just want to go, and look at art, and swim in the Adriatic.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: And spend time with George Emerson.  That's what I would do.  I mean it's the best male protagonist we've read, right?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [joins them at the table] Totally, I mean, come on, such a free spirit.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: What are you doing?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Just came to discuss my favorite E.M. Forester novel.  Pam, these finger sandwiches look finger-lickin' delicious Pam.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Uh, I'm sorry Andy, but this is a closed club.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: The Finer Things Club is the most exclusive club in this office.  Naturally, it's where I need to be.  The party planning committee is my back up, and Kevin's band is my safety.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Fine.  I'll just sit here, in the common area, and read my book.  Which just happens to be the very same book you're reading.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Alright, just know that you're not in the Finer Things Club.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Why can't I be in the club?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I can't believe we're here, I can't believe this is happening.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Believe it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Afro wig, do you want the afro wig?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No, Michael.  I'm not leaving the car.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, Dwight, here's how it's going to go down.  You and I-

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Guy's going by. Shh.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You and I are going to sneak inside and pretend that we are warehouse workers.  And then we will silly string the beejeezus out of the place.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: And if we have to defend ourselves, I will stab the security guy in the eye with the jumbo chalk.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No, no, you won't do that. Nope.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Then I'll grind up the jumbo chalk and blow it in his eyes.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Dwight, nothing with the eyes, please?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Okay, Jim.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh my God, that's her! That's her, go, go, go.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Let's move! Move, move, move, move!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Shut up, you, shut up!  This is the dumbest thing we've ever done.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I think it's interesting how Forster uses Italy to represent sexuality and passion. [Kevin dumping change in the snack machine] And that also brought up themes of, uh, you know, fate and coincidence.  And Lucy's torn between these two things.  She's torn between passion and convention.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Damn it!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: It just- [Kevin banging and shaking the snack machine]  To be making a case for passion in Edwardian times, I thought was, uh...

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Damn it! [banging machine]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Maybe sort of ahead of his time as a writer.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Very brave. [Phyllis beeping microwave in the background]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Very brave choice also, I thought.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: And George, his- his youthfulness.  His, um, freedom.  [Phyllis still beeping the microwave] Evokes, um, um, feeling, um, to the, um...  What are you microwaving!?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Popcorn.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Why don't you use the microwave in the kitchen, Phyllis?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Someone needs to clean it.  It smells like popcorn.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: So, Stanley, are you really outta here?

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Yep, looks that way.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I'm gonna miss you man, you've been like an uncle to me.  Like a kind old uncle Remus.  I wanna stay in touch.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [from the walkie-talkie] We are in a stairwell.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [from the walkie-talkie] We are climbing some stairs.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I'm breathing heavily.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay, you know what?  You don't need to be updating me as much as you're updating me.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Well...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: There's a guy, there's a guy.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: There's a security guard coming by.  Hello, we're warehouse workers.  Would you like more proof?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh my God, oh my God, that was very close.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I can see the security guard's eyes.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No, no, don't do anything to them.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I have to do something to his eyes.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: The eyes are the groin of the head.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Alright, Great Scott, if you found that choking hazard poster, just head on home.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: We found something far better, their crown jewel.  Their industrial copier.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Isn't that thing huge?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It's enormous, but it's got wheels.  We're wheeling it down the hall, into the stairwell.  Get the car ready, keep the engine running.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No, that is a terrible idea, don't do this.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Aha! [crashing]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: My hip bone!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: We're wedged between the copier and the railing. Ah! Ow! Ow, my leg!  Jim leave us.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Don't leave us!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Save yourself!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Don't leave us, help us, we need help Jim!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay! First of all, stop using my name.  And second of all-

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Dwight, you gotta move!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Damn it guys!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Dwight, could you move over a little bit.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I'm losing control of my bladder.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh my God, oh my God, Karen is back!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Did you say Karen?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Take her to a motel, make love to her Jim.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No, I'm not doing that.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Just say you wanna get back together.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No, I'm not doing that!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It doesn't have to mean anything.  Just, do it for Stanley.  Come on Jim, just climb on top of her and think about Stanley.  Ah, Jim, if this is it for me, promise me something, host the Dundies.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Jim?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey Karen.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Uh, what are you doing here?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: First of all, hi.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: What are you doing here?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You good?  I'm just checking on the other branches.  Michael wants me to do that from time to time, so...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Do not tell Karen about the industrial copier.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Copy that.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: I cried for weeks over that guy, so yeah, seeing him climb out of a PT Cruiser in a ladies warehouse uniform, felt pretty good.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Let me ask you, did you accomplish what you wanted?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Listen lady, you can expect these kind of repercussions as long as you keep trying to poach our people.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: I'm taking Stanley.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Then we will burn Utica to the ground.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [whispers] Dwight.  Granted, maybe this was not the best idea, but at least we care enough about our employees that we are willing to fight for them.  And if you so much as harm a hair on Stanley's head, we will burn Utica to the ground. [they get up to leave]

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Jim, hang on a second?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yes?

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: So you're still doing this kind of stuff, huh?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah, trying to quit though.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: If you wanted to see me, you could have just called me like an adult.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh no, I didn't want to see you.  Not that I'm not happy seeing you, right now, I'm just saying ultimately I was here for the copier.  Equal, I'd say it was equal.  So, good to see you...

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: [huffs]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I mean, it's just that- [clears throat] You know, Pam and I are still dating, so, and, I just mean that things are going really well, so I didn't want to see... you...

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Oh, things are going really well?  Are they?  They are?  That's great, that's so great.  I wanna hear more about how happy you are with Pam.  Can you tell me more about that?  Thank you so much for coming to Utica, and breaking my copier, and telling me how well things are going in your relationship, really, thank you.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [slinking out of the room] Alright, you are welcome.  I'm going to go because of, um, traffic.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Traffic, yeah.  Oh, def- go, go because of traffic, definitely, beat-beat the traffic, mm-hmm.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I... will... [gives up and walks away]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: We tried and we failed.  Stanley, you may go.  Here is a box, for your things, but I doubt that that box will be able to contain all the memories that you have of this place.  Fly away sweet little bird, fly away and be free.  Pam, I'm gonna need some help writing a want ad.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Um, wanted:

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: I wasn't really planning on leaving, all I wanted was a raise.  How on Earth did Michael call my bluff?  Is he some sort of secret genius? [laughs] Sometimes I say crazy things.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I'm so sorry, Rolando told me everything.  How humiliating.  Would it help you to return to another age?  A time of refinement, and civility.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Are you inviting me to the Finer Things Club?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [nods head yes]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Oh-oh, come on!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [Irish accent] Angela's Ashes, top o' the morning to us.  Frankie's prose is funnier than a pot of gold, say I.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Okay, did you get it out of your system.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yep.  No, I mean I really liked it.  I thought was uh, a fun read.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Fun?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Mm-hmm.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Really?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: What was fun about it for you?  Was it the death of the twins?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No, that wasn't fun.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Did you even read it?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Of course I read it.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: How does it end?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Who was the main character?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Angela.  Nope.  The ashes.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [mouths "I'm sorry" to Oscar]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: And let me just add, that as a member of The Finer Things Club, I would bring a strong financial contribution to any discretionary funds that we may have.  Finally, here is a recommendation from former U.S. Senator Rick Santorum.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Okay, that's enough, uh.  Thanks, Andy.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Mmmhmm. [leaves]

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: He's gonna ruin everything.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, my God.  His letter of recommendation from Rick Santorum is three fifty-dollar bills.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Wow.  Now we can afford hard-cover books.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: I like it just us three.  [very quietly] I don't want it to change.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: I love The Finer Things Club.  My ex-wife used to have a book club, and I would read their book and sometimes listen from the kitchen.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: The Finer Things Club was not sanctioned by the Party Planning Committee.  Renegade clubs are dangerous.  I squashed the Weight Loss Buddy Support Group.  They didn't need to gather.  It was just gross.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: [slurping her from her big cup] I don't know why I'm not in The Finer Arts Club [slurring].  It's bullcrap. [throws her cup on the floor, something splashes on the camera]  You clean it up.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [opens envelope Toby has handed him] Dear Andrew Bernard, after carefully examining your application to The Finer Things Club, we are unable to offer you a position at this place and time.  We would, however, like to place you on a list in case an opportunity arises when your inclusion can be tolerated.  Your position as an ongoing financial patron, however, is yours to cherish.  Sincerely, The Finer Things Club. [pauses to consider]  Yeees!  [to Phyllis] I got waitlisted.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I got into Cornell off the Wait List.  A lot of people were like, "Oh, you just got into Cornell because your dad donated a building."  No.  Okay.  I got into Cornell because I'm smart.  I'm smart enough to have a dad who donates buildings to things.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Utica is snoozeville, um, Albany are the prepsters, Nashua, no parking, um, Akron is haunted, Camden... is in a basement, Yonkers has the two hot girls, and here in Scranton, we are the cool guys.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Woo!  Shotgun!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Well, you're driving, right?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes, I am, but I want shotgun for you.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Mmm... I'd prefer to sit in back.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Wait!  I wanted to sit next to you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, Dwight!  Dwight, Jim is sitting next to me.  You're gonna sit in the back left  where I don't have to see your ugly moongob.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Okay, that is so mean!  You know what, I'm not going.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I'm sorry.  I'm sorry.  Dwight, you're handsome.  You're a very handsome man, get in the car.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Woohoo!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [on phone] So, there was no sales call.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Nnnno.  Uh, turns out, it was just a really bad idea involving fire.  But I think I fixed it.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Wait, you're going along with this now?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I have to.  Pam, if I'm not there, someone's going to go to jail.  Or die.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Right.  And, you wouldn't be able to talk to Karen.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Well, I promise you that has nothing to do with it.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: A little bit.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Well, yeah I don't want to see her get physically harmed, that's for sure.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Because you love her?  [baby voice]  Because you love her very much?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: All right, I'm gonna go now.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Okay.  Have fun with your girlfriend!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay, I will. [idiot voice]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I'm kidding around.  We joke about that stuff all the time.  I'm not really the jealous type, so, I don't care if Jim sees Karen.  I care a little.

quotes.speaker: Security Guard
quotes.text: They sprayed me in the eye. [Dwight and Michael are trapped by/under a copier in the stairwell]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [moans] Scranton rules! [sprays Silly Spray]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Dwight!  Stop it!  [moans]  Can you help me please, I'm being crushed.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Would it have killed you to spend the afternoon making love to her in a motel room?  Like I begged you to?  Pam would have understood.  Heck, Pam would have done it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Pam is down for anything.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You embarrassed me.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You embarrassed us.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yeah.  We shoulda brought Andy.  I cut a chunk out of my penis for nothing.
